meanings.definition: Having a raised or elevated line or strip
meanings.sent1: The ridged roof of the house provided extra shade during the hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: The ridged edges of the coin made it easy to distinguish from the others.
meanings.sent3: The ridged pattern on the socks made them look like tiny mountains.
meanings.sent4: The ridged landscape of the desert stretched out endlessly before us.
meanings.sent5: The ridged bark of the tree felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Marked by or as if by ridges
meanings.sent1: The ridged path through the forest was easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: Her ridged forehead showed signs of worry and stress.
meanings.sent3: The ridged pattern on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The ridged waves in the sand reminded me of a giant fingerprint.
meanings.sent5: The ridged outline of the mountain stood out against the sky.

meanings.definition: Having a rough surface or texture with raised areas
meanings.sent1: The ridged texture of the fabric made it perfect for scrubbing.
meanings.sent2: His ridged hands showed the hard work he put into his job.
meanings.sent3: The ridged surface of the chocolate bar made it difficult to break apart.
meanings.sent4: The ridged terrain of the hiking trail provided a challenging adventure.
meanings.sent5: The ridged feel of the sandpaper helped smooth out the rough edges.
